result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Amelia M Watson

defendant.name: Watson, Amelia M
defendant.address: S78 W20574 Pasadena Dr, Muskego, WI 53150

records.addlTxt:
Case called at 10:03 AM
Intern Nikole Kane in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Attorney Angela Wang in court for Amelia M Watson.  
Defendant Amelia M Watson in court. 
State previously filed an Information with the Court.
Defense enters a not guilty plea.
Attorney Wang requests another hearing date.
Hearing scheduled for November 14, 2022 at 10:00 am.

08:28 AM Defendant Amelia M Watson in court with attorney Angela Wang.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern Julian Marrufo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  The State to file an information.  Attorney Wang is asking for an arraignment date before the Trial Court.  The Court will set this for arraignment before the Trial Court.
Defendant waives her right to a Preliminary Hearing.

If DNA sample has not been taken from the defendant, the Court orders sample to be taken;  and it may be expunged under 165.77(4) Wis. Statutes.  Defendant to have no contact with Victim A listed in the Criminal Complaint/Victim Identification Key.  Defendant is not to share, reproduce or distribute any personal and/or identifying information about the crime victim(s), except to their attorney.

08:28 AM Defendant Amelia M Watson in court with attorney Angela Wang.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern Julian Marrufo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint.  Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties.  Arraignment scheduled for September 9, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Defendant's Demand for Discovery and Inspection.
